title: RAISINS
text:
Here you can calculate the sample size required for your survey or study based on your desired confidence level, margin of error, and expected proportion. This tool supports both large (infinite) and finite population scenarios, helping you determine how many responses you need to achieve statistically valid results.



  
    üéØ Interactive Sample Size Calculator

    
      Population Size (N)
      üí°
    
    
    
      The (estimated or guess) total number of people or units in the population you're studying. If it's unknown or very large, leave it blank and the calculator will assume an infinite population.
    

    
      Margin of Error (%) [E]
      üí°
    
    
      
      5%
    
    
      A smaller margin means a larger required sample size. A 5% margin means your result may vary ¬±5% from the true value.
    

    
      Expected Proportion (p)
      üí°
    
    
      
      0.50
    
    
      This is your best guess of the proportion of the population with the trait. Use 0.5 if unsure ‚Äî it gives the largest required sample size.
    

    
      Confidence Level (Z)
      üí°
    
    
      80%
      85%
      90%
      95%
      99%
    
    
      How confident you want to be in the result. 95% means the result will be within margin of error in 95 of 100 surveys.
    

    

    
  üìò Explanation: How Sample Size is Calculated
  
    Determining the appropriate sample size is a critical step in designing any statistical survey or research study. When you want to estimate a proportion (for example, the percentage of farmers adopting a new technology), the required sample size depends on four main factors: the confidence level, the expected proportion, the acceptable margin of error, and the total population size.
  

  üîπ 1. Formula for Infinite Population
  The basic formula for estimating sample size when the population is assumed to be very large (effectively infinite) is:
  
    n‚ÇÄ = (Z¬≤ √ó p √ó (1 ‚àí p)) / E¬≤
  
  
    n‚ÇÄ: The minimum required sample size assuming an infinite population.
    Z: The Z-score (standard normal value) corresponding to the desired confidence level.
      For example: Z = 1.96 for 95% confidence, Z = 1.64 for 90%, etc.
    p: The expected proportion of the population having the characteristic of interest.
      Use 0.5 if unknown, as it gives the most conservative (largest) sample size.
    E: The desired margin of error (as a decimal).
      For example: E = 0.05 for ¬±5% precision.
  

  üîπ 2. Finite Population Correction (FPC)
  If your population size N is not very large, a correction to adjust the sample size is applied. The corrected formula is:
  
    n = n‚ÇÄ / [1 + ((n‚ÇÄ ‚àí 1) / N)]
    
  
  ‚úÖ Key Insights
  
    A smaller margin of error increases the required sample size.
    Higher confidence levels require larger samples.
    If you are unsure about the expected proportion, use p = 0.5 to get the largest (safest) estimate.
    Finite population correction is important when your total population is relatively small.
  

  
    üìö Reference: Cochran, W. G. (1977). Sampling Techniques (3rd ed.). New York: John Wiley & Sons.

title: RAISINS
text:
At RAISINS, we believe in accessibility and flexibility for all learners. That‚Äôs why each app is available as an independent module, allowing you to subscribe only to the tools you need. Whether you‚Äôre analyzing a simple test or running complex analysis modules, you can unlock any app on a monthly or 6-month basis, starting at just ‚Çπ199. This modular approach is perfect for individual students and researchers who need targeted analysis without the commitment of a full institutional plan. Simply click on the app listed under Analysis Modules and choose a monthly or 6-month license, starting at just ‚Çπ199. This modular subscription is perfect for students and researchers who need access to specific tools for a limited period.

üí° Module Licenses are specific to individual apps and are ideal for personal or single-user access. If you are affiliated with an academic or research institution and require full access to all RAISINS modules, please refer to the Institutional License section below and encourage your institution to partner with us.

title: RAISINS
text:
üè´ Institutional License
We also offer comprehensive Institutional Licenses to support collaborative research and academic teaching. These plans provide Access to all RAISINS apps for a fixed number of users within a department, college, or university. Whether you‚Äôre supervising a small team or managing a large institution, there‚Äôs a plan designed to fit your scale and scope.

Institutional licenses are ideal for teaching labs, research projects, and campus-wide adoption of RAISINS.

title: RAISINS
text:
Thank you for helping improve RAISINS. If you‚Äôve encountered a bug, suggestion, or problem, we provide two simple ways to reach us:



If you have a GitHub account, click below to file an issue directly in our GitHub repository:
  File a GitHub Issue 




If you do not have a GitHub account: File a feedback‚Üí
you can email us:

üì¨ Email: support@statoberry.com
üìû Contact page: Go to contact‚Üí





We do not store any uploaded data or personal information. Every session is temporary and deleted once you close the app.

For more, read our Privacy & Data Policy.


If you‚Äôre reporting a technical issue, please include: - The name of the module - A brief description of the issue - A screenshot or error message (if any)

title: RAISINS
text:
Welcome to the Discussion Corner!
This is an open space for researchers, students, and data enthusiasts to discuss anything related to statistics, data analysis, and research methodology, not just limited to RAISINS. Have a new idea for a statistical method? Struggling with the right technique for your experiment? Recently published a paper or came across an interesting approach in your field? Let‚Äôs explore it together.
We‚Äôre listening and evolving. If there‚Äôs a feature, model, or analysis you think would benefit others, suggest it here. Your contributions can directly shape what RAISINS offers next.
Let‚Äôs build a vibrant and collaborative statistical community

title: 1 Cite Us ‚Äì RAISINS
text:
1 Cite Us ‚Äì RAISINS



  
  
  

 

  If you are using RAISINS, please cite the following publication:

  
  
    APA Style
    Hisham M, M., Chandran, J., & Gopinath, P. P. (2025). RAISINS: Integrating R and AI for Agricultural Data Analysis. Journal of Sustainable Technology in Agriculture, 1(1). PAPAYA Academic Press. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15622128
  

  
  
    Harvard Style
    Hisham M, M., Chandran, J. and Gopinath, P.P., 2025. RAISINS: Integrating R and AI for Agricultural Data Analysis. Journal of Sustainable Technology in Agriculture, 1(1). PAPAYA Academic Press. Available at: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15622128
  

  
  
    BibTeX
    @article{mohammed2025raisins,
  title     = {RAISINS: Integrating R and AI for Agricultural Data Analysis},
  author    = {Hisham, M. M. and Chandran, J. and Gopinath, P. P.},
  journal   = {Journal of Sustainable Technology in Agriculture},
  volume    = {1},
  number    = {1},
  year      = {2025},
  publisher = {PAPAYA Academic Press},
  doi       = {10.5281/zenodo.15622128},
  url       = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15622128}
}
  

  
  
    üîó View on Zenodo
    üìÑ View Online Version

title: Welcome to RAISINS
text:
Analysis Modules
Doing a statistical analysis has never been easier. Simply select the appropriate analysis module listed below to launch the application. Our platform operates on secure cloud infrastructure to ensure high-performance computing for your data analysis. To support sustained access and development, a modest subscription is required per module. These plans are thoughtfully structured to remain affordable for students and researchers. Once subscribed, access the app and upload your dataset and click Run Analysis the results are generated instantly, with accuracy and clarity.






 Preview Mode



Explore any app for free using  Preview Mode ‚Äî no registration needed. Just enter your email and OTP to begin. Use this mode for Explore, teaching, training programmes or hands-on practice. To upload your own data for analysis, a subscription is required. Model datasets are available within Preview Mode.
Making Statistics Sweet



Analysis of Experiments

  
  
  
    
      Single Factor Experiments
    
 
  
     CRD (Completely Randomized Design)
  
  
    
  

    
      
         RBD (Randomized Block Design)
      
      
    
  
    
      
      
         One-Way ANCOVA in CRD
      
      
    
    
      Two Factor Experiments
    
    
      
         2FCRD (Two Factor Factorial CRD)
      
    
    
      
         2FRCBD (Two Factor Factorial RBD)
      
    
    
      
         Split-plot Designs
      
    
    
      
         Strip-plot Designs
      
    
    
    
      Pooled Analysis
    
    
      
         RBD Pooled Analysis
      
    
        
      Non Parametric
    
    
      
         Kruskal-Wallis Test
      
    
  



Statistical Genetics

  
  
    
      
         Stability Analysis (Eberhart and Russell's Model)
      
    
  



Social Science Tools

  
  
     
      
         Sample Size Calculator
      
    
    
      
         Exploratory Factor Analysis
      
    
    
      
        Binary Logistic Regression
      
    
  



Custom Tools

Tools for KAU

  
  
    
      
         CABBAGE for KAU referencing style
      
    
  







Institutional login



At RAISINS, we deeply value academic collaborations and are committed to making statistical analysis easy, affordable, and enjoyable. If you believe your institution could benefit from access to RAISINS, we encourage you to inform the relevant authority to get in touch with us. We offer customised plans, our unique flavours‚Äîto match the research needs of your institution.Click here to explore Institutional Licensing for RAISINS.

title: RAISINS
text:
At RAISINS by Statoberry LLP, we are committed to protecting your privacy. We do not collect or store any personally identifiable information unless explicitly provided by the user for communication or support purposes.

We do not use third-party advertising tools.
We do not share your data with any third parties.
We collect only anonymized usage data (e.g., feature usage frequency) to improve platform performance and user experience.

Your use of RAISINS is secure, and we ensure that no unauthorized access occurs to any part of your interaction with the platform.

title: RAISINS
text:
At RAISINS by Statoberry LLP, we are committed to protecting your privacy. We do not collect or store any personally identifiable information unless explicitly provided by the user for communication or support purposes.

We do not use third-party advertising tools.
We do not share your data with any third parties.
We collect only anonymized usage data (e.g., feature usage frequency) to improve platform performance and user experience.

Your use of RAISINS is secure, and we ensure that no unauthorized access occurs to any part of your interaction with the platform.

title: RAISINS
text:
Data Policy
RAISINS operates on a temporary, cloud-based computing environment.

No uploaded data is stored permanently.
Every analysis session is a virtual instance. Once the session ends (i.e., when the user closes the app or navigates away), all uploaded files, temporary outputs, and analysis results are permanently deleted.
No backup copies are created, and no user input is saved unless explicitly exported by the user.

This ensures that your data remains confidential and fully under your control. We do not retain any files, results, or metadata beyond the duration of your session.

üí° In short: No uploaded data is stored anywhere. Once the user quits, everything in that session is lost forever.

title: RAISINS
text:
Refund Policy
Statoberry LLP strives to provide a high-quality experience with RAISINS. Our refund policy is as follows:

For one-time purchases or subscriptions made in error, please contact us within 7 days of payment.
Refunds are not issued if a module was purchased in error; however, we will gladly switch access to the correct module upon request.
Refunds are only considered if the user was unable to access a module for more than one day (24 hrs) due to technical failure.
Institutional and multi-user licenses are non-refundable once activated, except in cases of verified technical failure that prevents access.

To request a refund, email us at support@statoberry.com with your order details and reason for the request. We review all requests individually and aim to process valid claims within 7 working days.

For questions about any of the above policies, feel free to contact us at support@statoberry.com.
